required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Ultrasonic Morphological Study of the Great Auricular Nerve and Adjacent Structures
clinical_study.official_title: Morphological Study of the Great Auricular Nerve and Adjacent Structures by Ultrasound Imaging and Transcutaneous Nerve Stimulation

brief_summary.textblock: Ultrasound-guided nerve block has the characteristics of high success rate, few complications, and high patient satisfaction. It has been widely used in brachial plexus and lumbar plexus nerve blocks. Studies of ultrasound-guided superficial cervical plexus block are mostly unsatisfactory, and may be due to anatomic localization of the puncture site rather than real-time ultrasound guidance. The great auricular nerve is the largest branch of the superficial cervical plexus and may be identified under ultrasound. The aim of this study is to establish the success rate of identification of the great auricular nerve by combining ultrasound imaging with transcutaneous nerve stimulation. In addition, we will study the relationship between the success rate of identification and the related factors of patients. Another purpose of this study is to locate the position where the great auricular nerve emerges the posterior border of the sternocleidomastoid muscle. The relationship between this point and the midpoint of posterior border of the sternocleidomastoid muscle and adjacent structures will also be studied.

primary_outcome.measure: Success rate of identification of the great auricular nerve combining ultrasound imaging with transcutaneous nerve stimulation
primary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients who's great auricular nerve was identified by combining ultrasound imaging with transcutaneous nerve stimulation

secondary_outcome.description: Patients were divided into two groups according to whether they recognized the great auricular nerve or not, and the differences in gender composition were compared.
Patients were divided into two groups according to whether they recognized the great auricular nerve or not, and the differences in BMI were compared.
Patients were divided into two groups according to whether they recognized the great auricular nerve or not, and the differences in body fat rate were compared.
Patients were divided into two groups according to whether they recognized the great auricular nerve or not, and the differences in neck circumference were compared.

secondary_outcome.measure: Success rate of identification of the great auricular nerve by ultrasound
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients who's great auricular nerve was identified by ultrasound
the distance between the point where the great auricular nerve emerges the posterior border of the sternocleidomastoid muscle and the midpoint of posterior border of the sternocleidomastoid muscle
length of the posterior border of the sternocleidomastoid muscle

study_pop.textblock: Patients who underwent surgery in our hospital during the study, especially neck surgery, such as cervical surgery, thyroid surgery, and carotid endarterectomy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients undergoing surgery in changzheng hospital
Exclusion Criteria:
- Suffering from malignant tumors, poor overall condition
- Communication barriers, unable to objectively describe symptoms
- Huge mass in the neck
